Tips for photographing birds:

1. Use a telephoto lens (300mm or longer recommended)
2. Be patient and wait for the bird to settle
3. Use a fast shutter speed (1/500s or faster) to freeze motion
4. Focus on the eye - sharp eyes make a great photo
5. Use natural light, avoid harsh midday sun
6. Get eye-level with the bird when possible
7. Use continuous shooting mode for action shots
8. Keep the background uncluttered
9. Be quiet and move slowly to avoid scaring birds
10. Visit locations where birds are accustomed to people

For identification, capture clear shots of:
â€¢ Full body profile
â€¢ Head and beak details
â€¢ Wing patterns (when spread)
â€¢ Tail shape and markings
